action.action-desc: Mrs. Boebert (for herself, Mr. Buck, and Mr. Lamborn) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey to Mesa County, Colorado, certain Federal land in Colorado, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Clifton Opportunities Now for Vibrant Economic Yields Act or as the CONVEY Act.

section.header: Conveyance of Federal land to Mesa County, Colorado

paragraph.text: The term Clifton parcel means the approximately 31.1 acres of Federal land depicted as 31.1 Acres to be Conveyed to Mesa County on the map titled Clifton Opportunities Now for Vacant Earth Yields (CONVEY) Act and dated February 27, 2023.
The term County means Mesa County, Colorado.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Land Management.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding the Secretarial Order dated August 26, 1902, and the Secretarial Order dated July 25, 1908, the Secretary shall convey to the County, as soon as practicable, all rights, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Clifton parcel.
The conveyance under this section shall be—

paragraph.text: subject to valid existing rights; and
for not less than fair market value, as determined in accordance with subsection (d).
The fair market value of the Clifton parcel shall be determined by an independent appraisal obtained by the Secretary.
The appraisal required by paragraph (1) shall be conducted in accordance with the—

subparagraph.text: Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions; and
Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2), the Secretary shall pay all costs associated with the conveyance required under subsection (b).
The County shall pay all costs associated with any survey conducted for the purpose of accomplishing the conveyance required under subsection (b).

subsection.text: The proceeds from the conveyance required under subsection (b) shall be—

paragraph.text: deposited into the Federal Land Disposal Account established by the Federal Land Transaction Facilitation Act (43 U.S.C. 2301 et seq.); and
available for expenditure under that Act.
As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall finalize a map and a legal description of all land to be conveyed under this Act.
In the case of a discrepancy between the map and the legal description created under paragraph (1), the map shall control.
The Secretary and the County, by mutual agreement, may correct any minor errors in the map or the legal description created under paragraph (1).
The map and the legal description created under paragraph (1) shall be kept on file and available for public inspection in each appropriate office of the Bureau of Land Management.
